posts.name: James
posts.cooked: My team trying to run a rev maxplanetary gearbox (just a 3:1) which outputs to a spline xs shaft for a gear. Is there something for this, like an adapter or can I get the maxplanetary gearboxes with a spline xs output?

link_counts.title: The Thrifty Bot 2024 - 2025 Product Releases & Updates

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked:
Various Adapters for common FRC components. Access User Guide, Kit Contents & More!

Price: USD 14.99

Is it not on here?

I am having a little trouble grasping your setup though.

posts.name: Ira Pino
posts.cooked:
How much torque do you need for this application? If possible, I’d 3d print the part you’re asking about (out of something strong like nylon or cf filled stuff preferably). I don’t think there are any 1/2 hex to male spline xs shaft adapters, although you might also be able to get away with a piece of spline xs shaft (idk if they are sold discretely) and a 1/2 hex Spline XS interior adapter (these: https://store.ctr-electronics.com/products/wcp-splinexs-adapter ). Also, it might be easier to just 3d print the gear and the 1/2 hex piece as the same part or to simply switch to a different gear ratio and change the MAXplanetary’s stage value to something higher.

The other option would be something like this, which you could cut down as needed for packaging:

REV Robotics designs, builds and manufactures robotics parts and components used by students for learning about science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). Our parts are commonly used within the FIRST Robotics Competition and the FIRST Tech...

Price: USD 12

posts.name: Elliot S
posts.cooked:
I assume you want something like this: image 1698×1302 40.4 KB The image shown above is of a versa planetary gearbox with a 8mm keyed(cim/neo) output shaft. We realized last year we need more reduction so we added this to our elevator last year. I don’t think anything like this exist for the max planetary system at the moment.

image 1698×1302 40.4 KB

image 1698×1302 40.4 KB

posts.name: Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)
posts.cooked:
Yeah, that part doesn’t exist.  I don’t know what gear it is you’re using, but you might be better off hunting down a hex version of it (or shuffling around tooth counts in your system to get something that fits on 1/2" hex).

A small-gear output shaft for MP does feel like a chance for someone’s machine shop to make some money though.

posts.name: Ira Pino
posts.cooked:
That part doesn’t exist, but if you want to minimize the redesign work what I’d suggest (basically what’s in my previous post) is:

either combining the yellow, orange, and purple parts into one 3d printed piece if it’s a low enough load application that that’d be ok

or combining the orange and yellow bits into one piece, which would be the 15t spline Vortex shaft linked above with the bit below the 1/2 gex section cut off (there is a tapped hole which extends into the 1/2 hex portion from that side so you can still retain it to the MP output)

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked:
As a similar thought,

May be able to get down to an 8mm keyed gear, as it should be easier to adapt that back to half inch hex.

posts.name: Rod
posts.cooked:
Your best bet is to get some solid steel or 7075 hex stock, turn it down to 8mm, and cut the 2mm keyway.  You are going to be at some risk of twisting off the shaft if you have a big pre-reduction!

The only way to get a Kraken spline is to saw it off a motor.  Hopefully a dead one!  No zombie Krakens, please…

A Falcon spline can be bought as a replacement part.  Or at least used to be available…

Both are super fiddly to cut!

posts.name: James
posts.cooked: Yea I think we are just going to 3DP it all together and try. And if that doesn’t work we can definitely just redesign in some other way.

posts.name: Elliot S
posts.cooked:
Seem our dreams have come true!
